turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about WLRO.
turn.1: What is the difference between WLRO and other radio stations?
turn.2: WLRO  WLRO (1210 AM, "1210 The Score") was a sports talk formatted radio station serving the Baton Rouge area of the U.S. state of Louisiana.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: The iHeartMedia, Inc. station broadcast with an ERP of 10 kW-D/1 kW-N power and was licensed to Denham Springs (where the transmitter was located).
turn.6: Its studios were located east of downtown Baton Rouge near the I-10/I-12 interchange.
turn.7: What were some of the early programs?
turn.8: AM 1210 was originally a Christian talk radio station, WBIU, until 1997 when it was acquired by Clear Channel (forerunner to iHeartMedia) and switched to a sports talk format, under the call letters WSKR.
turn.10: It was an ESPN Radio affiliate until February 2007, when it switched to Fox Sports Radio.
turn.12: On January 2, 2012, WSKR changed its format to gospel, branded as "Hallelujah 1210" under new call letters, WLRO.
